name: Advanced Training
narative: When the going gets tough, it’s probably better that this character goes the other way!
description:
Choose a Skill that meets this Talent’s requirement. When performing a duel using the chosen Skill, the character increases her final duel total by +1.

A character can take this Talent multiple times, but each time a different Skill must be chosen.

name: Armor Training
narative: This character has learned how to properly wear her armor in such a way that it doesn’t impair her movements.
description:
This character reduces the penalty to Defense from wearing armor by 1, to a minimum of 0.

A character can take this Talent multiple times.

name: Back to the Wall
narative: When there’s nowhere to run, this character hunkers down and prepares for the worst.
description: When this character is within 1 yard of a wall or other solid object at least as tall as she is, she gains +1 Defense.

name: Better Part of Valor
narative: When the going gets tough, it’s probably better that this character goes the other way!
description: This character’s Charge Aspect becomes “—” (rendering her unable to take the Charge Action), but she gains a +2 to her Walk Aspect.

name: Blissful Ignorance
narative: This character is somewhat unaware of the details around her. While this certainly has its disadvantages, it also comes in handy from time to time, particularly when she just fails to notice how frightening her opponents are.
description: When this character fails a Horror Duel, if it is her turn, her current Action immediately fails, but she does not become **Paralyzed.** If it is not her turn, she becomes **Slow** instead of **Paralyzed.**

name: Call Shot
narative: This character’s aim is quite good.
description: Choose a Skill. When this character generates a Critical Effect with an attack that used the chosen Skill, she may discard a card to change the suit of the Critical Effect to the suit of the discarded card. A character may take this Talent multiple times, but each time a different Skill must be chosen.

name: Calm And Collected
narative: This character has learned (or been forced to learn) that rushing only leads to mistakes.
description: This character adds +1 to the value of any **Focused** condition that she receives, to a maximum of **Focused +3**.

name: Clear Orders
narative: This character gives orders that are clear and concise.
description: When this character takes the Order Action to give commands to one or more subordinate characters, she may Cheat Fate for those characters.

name: Combat Reading
narative: This character is able to read a target during combat and strike at openings others might not see.
description: When making disengaging strikes, this character adds her Scrutiny Skill Ranks to her final duel total.

name: Counterspell
narative: Training in the art of Counter-Spelling has given this character an intuitive ability to resist magic.
description: Training in the art of Counter-Spelling has given this character an intuitive ability to resist magic. When this character is targeted by an enemy’s Magical Action, the enemy loses any suits associated with their Magical Skill.

name: Critical Strike
displayedReqs: Requirement: Close Combat or Ranged Combat Skill 3 or higher.
narative: A skilled attacker is often able to deal more damage than a common thug, and this character is no exception to that rule.
description:
Choose a Skill that meets this Talent’s requirement. All attacks with the chosen Skill gain the following Trigger:

[r] *Critical Strike*: When damaging, deal 1 additional damage for each [r] in the final duel total.

A character may take this Talent multiple times, but each time a different Skill must be chosen.

name: Defensive Protocols
narative: This character is able to organize her subordinates into loose defensive formations with little effort.
description: This character’s subordinate characters that are within [a] 6 of her may choose to flip cards when they are attacked, in the same manner as a Fated character.

name: Duck and Cover
narative: This character knows how to avoid unpleasant surprises like flying shrapnel and roaring flames.
description: This character gains the following ability: **Blast Resistant +1**: Reduce all damage this character suffers from [p] and [b] effects by +1, to a minimum of 1.

name: Flick of the Wrist
narative: This character is precise with her weapon where others rely on brute strength.
description: When making a Melee or Pugilism attack, this character may substitute Grace for Might when calculating her Acting value.

name: Governor's Gift
narative: Some people just have a way with members of a certain gender.
description: Choose male or female. This character gains [+] on any Bewitch or Scrutiny duels made against members of the chosen gender.

name: Cynic
narative: Some people just can’t look on the bright side of life no matter how hard they might try. If it sounds too good to be true, this character starts getting suspicious and questioning the motives of others.
description: This character gains [+] on any duel made to resist deception (including Deceive and Pick Pocket Challenges, as well as the Trick Action).

name: Great Fate
narative: Fate smiles upon this character, allowing her to manipulate her destiny more frequently.
description: When this character draws her Control Hand at the end of the Prologue, she draws one additional card. A character may take this Talent multiple times, and its effects stack.

name: Gruesome Attack
displayedReqs: Requirement: Close Combat or Ranged Combat Skill 3 or higher.
narative: Combat is a dangerous thing, especially when this character is involved.
description: Choose a Skill that meets this Talent's requirements. All Critical Effect flips this character generates from attacks using the chosen Skill receive [+]. A character may take this Talent multiple times, but each time a different Skill must be chosen.

name: Gruff
narative: When this character speaks, there is little inflection or fancy wordplay, making it very difficult for others to discern her true intentions.
description: This character gains a [+] to Deceive and Intimidate Challenges.

name: Hobbling Attack
displayedReqs: Requirement: Close Combat or Ranged Combat Skill 3 or higher.
narative: This character can place an attack in just the right spot to slow her target down.
description:
Choose a Skill that meets this Talent’s requirement. All attacks with the chosen Skill gain the following Trigger:

[r] *Hobble*: After succeeding, the target gains the following Condition for the remainder of Dramatic Time: “**Hobbled**: This character may only declare one Movement General Action per turn and may not declare the Run Action.”

A character may take this Talent multiple times, but each time a different Skill must be chosen.

name: Honest
narative: This character doesn’t have to try to convince others to trust her; they can see that she has an honest nature.
description: This character gains [+] to all Convince and Leadership Duels.

name: Imposing Mass
narative: This character may not be very graceful, but she’s become quite good at using her physical size to her advantage in combat.
description: This character gains [+] to her disengaging strikes and to any Impose Action she takes.

name: Let Me Show You
narative: This character has a natural affinity for teaching other people how to do things.
description: She may spend 15 minutes and discard a Twist Card to explain how one of her General Talents works to another character. That character may then discard a Twist Card to gain the taught General Talent for the rest of the day. The taught character must still meet all the necessary physical prerequisites for the Talent (such as a pneumatic limb for a Talent involving pneumatic limbs or wings for a Talent involving flight). Talents with a requirement of Invested, Stitched, or Twisted cannot be taught to another character.

name: Open Hand Fighting
narative: Having a free hand can have its advantages in combat.
description: If the character is wielding a Melee weapon and has nothing in her other hand when she makes a successful disengaging strike, she may choose to have her disengaging strike deal damage to her target.

name: Paired Weapons
displayedReqs: Requirement: Close Combat or Ranged Combat Skill 3 or higher.
narative: This character is able to effectively wield two Melee or Ranged weapons at the same time.
description: Choose a Skill that meets this Talent’s requirement. When this character is wielding two weapons of the chosen type, one in each hand, she gains [+] to any attacks made with either weapon. The second weapon merely gives her a bonus to hit. If wielding two Ranged Combat weapons, this Talent expends one round of ammunition from each weapon.

name: Plain-Spoken
narative: This character doesn’t try to muddy her conversation with flowery language and is good at saying difficult truths efficiently.
description: This character gains [+] to Social Duels made during Dramatic Time.

name: Polyglot
narative: This character has a natural knack for languages. She learns them with little effort, and when speaking in a foreign tongue, her accent is all but unnoticeable.
description: When this character gains this Talent, she chooses two languages that she does not already speak and learns how to speak them. When conversing with another character in their native, non-English language, this character gains [+] to her Barter and Bewitch duels.

name: Quick Study
narative: Some people just learn quickly from watching others.
description: During the Epilogue, when presented with Skill Advancement options by the Fatemaster, this character may instead advance in any Skill she does not already possess instead of the Skill Advancement options presented by the Fatemaster. She must have witnessed a friendly character succeed at the chosen Skill at some point during the session.

name: Rush
narative: This character is adept at charging headlong into combat, taking the fight to the opponent in brutal melee.
description: The character increases her Charge Aspect by +1. A character may take this Talent multiple times, and its effects stack.

name: Secretive Spellcasting
narative: This character has learned to hide her spellcasting technique within the trappings of the Thalarian Doctrine.
description: When this character casts a Spell or Manifested power, she may discard a card to make her Magical Theory appear to be the Thalarian Doctrine to anyone who attempts to detect it.

name: Seize the Day
narative: This character has learned to overcompensate for her awkwardness in combat by ensuring that the fight ends before it can be an issue.
description: This character gains [+] to her Initiative flips.

name: Shot Studies
narative: Shotguns are second nature to this character. When firing slug ammunition from a shotgun and taking her time to line up a shot, she is capable of hitting targets that would otherwise be considered well outside her weapon's range.
description: If this character has the **Focused** Condition and is firing a shotgun loaded with slug ammunition, she multiplies the range of the shotgun by x10.

name: Shove Aside
narative: This character can barrel through others with little resistance, forcing them out of her way without so much as the slightest pause.
description: This character can move through characters with a Height lower than her own without being impeded. Such characters cannot make disengaging strikes against this character.

name: Shrug Off
narative: This character is so accustomed to minor pains that she can ignore them as the typical background noise of her existence.
description:
This character gains the following Tactical Action:

(0) Shrug Off: This character may discard a Twist card to end a Condition affecting her.

name: Specialized Skill
displayedReqs: Requirement: Fatemaster Character or 2 or more completed Destiny Steps.
narative: This character has honed a specific skill, allowing her to perform tricks with little effort.
description:
Choose a Skill and a suit. Add the chosen suit to the chosen Skill’s value.

A character may take this Talent multiple times, but each time, a different Skill must be chosen.

name: Specialized Toxins
narative: This character knows the perfect type of poison to deal with a specific kind of creature.
description:
The character chooses one of the following Characteristics: Living, Construct, Undead, Spirit, or Nightmare. When this character performs an Action or declares a Trigger that gives a target with the chosen Characteristic the **Poison** Condition, the target gains an additional **Poison** +1.

A character may take this Talent multiple times, but each time a different Characteristic must be chosen.

name: Speed Loading
displayedReqs: Requirement: Chosen Skill Rank 2 or higher.
narative: This character know how to quickly reload her weapon in combat.
description:
Choose the Long Arms, Pistols, Shotguns, or Heavy Weapons Skill. The character gains the following Trigger on any attack Action using the chosen Skill:

[r] Speed Loading: If this weapon’s Reload AP cost is 2 or lower, reload this weapon.

name: Steam-Powered Charge
displayedReqs: Requirement: Character must be a Construct or possess one or more pneumatic limbs.
narative: When this character charges her enemies, she can push her pneumatic limbs to their limits and hit them like a steam locomotive.
description: When this character declares the Charge Action, she may choose to make a single (1) AP or (2) AP Close Combat attack instead of two (1) AP Close Combat attacks. If she chooses to makes a single (1) AP Close Combat attack, it deals +1 damage and knocks the target **Prone** if successful.

name: Sturdy
narative: While this character might not be hardier or tougher than other characters, she can still push her body to endure wounds that would leave much larger men incapacitated or worse.
description:
This character gains +2 Wounds.

This Talent may be taken multiple times; each additional time this Talent is taken, this character gains +1 Wound.

name: Sure-Footed
narative: This character might not move quickly, but she’s also hard to budge.
description: When this character is pushed or moved by an effect, she may apply her Speed Aspect as a penalty to the distance (in yards) that she is pushed or moved by the effect.

name: Tenacious Warrior
narative: This rugged character doesn’t concern herself with pain or suffering, allowing her to ignore the worst parts of most attacks.
description: When an enemy makes a successful attack against this character and declares a Trigger, this character may discard a card. If she does so, the Trigger has no effect on her (though it may still affect others and the attack deals normal damage).

name: Threatening Posture
narative: This character is very threatening in combat, so much so that her presence often distracts opponents from the actions of her allies.
description: Enemies engaged with this character suffer a – penalty on Close Combat attacks made against targets other than her who do not also possess this Talent.

name: Tricky Shot
displayedReqs: Requirement: Chosen Skill Rank 2 or higher.
narative: This character is highly adept at pulling off tricky shots in a variety of conditions.
description: Choose a Ranged Combat Skill. While making an attack with the chosen Skill, this character may choose to ignore one –.

name: Twisted Fates
narative: Luck favors the prepared, as they say, but this character seems to be able to bend luck to her will more often than most.
description:
When this Talent is chosen, choose a card in the character’s Twist deck and permanently increase its value by 1, to a maximum value of 13.
A character may take this Talent multiple times.

name: Unassuming
narative: A lifetime of dealing with those stronger than her has taught this character how to present a calm manner and blend in.
description: This character gains + to any duels made to avoid being noticed in a group or angering someone.

name: Undermine Confidence
narative: Sometimes it’s better for the character to talk big and let nervousness set in slowly.
description: This character gains + to all Intimidate Challenges made during Narrative Time.

name: Unequaled Accuracy
displayedReqs: Requirement: Magical or Ranged Combat Skill 2 or higher.
narative: This character has an unequaled sense of timing when it comes to shooting into a chaotic fight.
description: Choose a Skill that meets this Talent’s requirement. This character does not randomize her target when firing into an engagement using the chosen Skill.

name: Wall of Muscle
narative: This character is both tall and wide, and she knows how to use her size to her advantage.
description: Increase this character’s Height to 3. In addition, increase the range of all [y] weapons wielded by this character by 1 yard, to a maximum of 3 yards.

name: Will of Ages
narative: This character has learned how to protect multiple characters from harmful magic.
description: When this character uses Magical Shielding, she may shield a number of additional friendly characters (including herself) equal to her Tenacity.

name: Advanced Sensors
description: This character gains a [+] on Notice duels and is capable of detecting things that other characters might miss, such as the presence of invisible creatures (though not their exact position) with a Difficult Notice Challenge.

name: Avoidant
narative: The character’s heightened sense of pain has encouraged her to become really, really good at avoiding it.
description: This character permanently loses 1 Wound but gains +1 Defense.

name: Blot the Sky
narative: Long hours of training and plenty of natural skill have allowed this character to fire multiple arrows with a single attack.
description: When the character makes an Archery attack, her Moderate damage gains +[b], and her Severe damage gains +[b][b] (provided that she expends two additional arrows per resulting +[b]).

name: Book Smart
narative: While this character has learned quite a bit from her books, all that reading has dulled her reaction time.
description: This character gains a [-] to Initiative but a [+] to all non-Magical Intellect Challenges.

name: C-C-C-Combo!!!!
narative: Whether it’s a string of fast punches or a spinning roundhouse kick, this character knows how to chain her attacks together into a flurry of blurred fists and kicking legs.
description:
The character gains the following Trigger on her Martial Arts Close Combat attacks:

*[m] Combo!*: This character may take this attack again against the same target. This second attack may not declare Triggers.

name: Channel Destiny
narative: This character is able to force Fate to twist around her, though the process is incredibly taxing, often producing blinding headaches and nosebleeds.
description: When this character performs a duel, she may suffer 2 damage before flipping any cards to add a suit of her choice to her final duel total. If this damage causes the character to suffer a Critical Effect or Toughness check to remain conscious, resolve the initial duel before checking for either.

name: Cheating So and So
narative: It’s one thing to play the odds, but it’s something else entirely to stack the game in your favor.
description:
The character gains the following Trigger on all Expertise Challenges:

*[m] Stack the Deck*: After resolving, you may look at the top card of the Fate deck and then choose whether or not to put it on the bottom of the deck.

name: Common Sense
narative: This character has a good head on her shoulders and can generally make sense of most things.
description: She may discard a Twist Card during Narrative Time to gain a [+] on a duel.

name: Concussive Force
narative: The force of this character’s blows physically moves her opponents backward.
description: Any time the character deals damage with the Martial Arts or Pugilism Skills, she may push her target directly away from her a number of yards equal to her Might Aspect.

name: Demanding Taskmaster
narative: This character knows how to use a bit of pain to spur others into action.
description:
The character gains the following Trigger on her Flexible Close Combat attacks:

*[m] Motivation*: After succeeding, move the target 1 yard if this attack dealt Weak damage, 2 yards if Moderate, and 3 yards if Severe.

name: Disarming Attack
narative: This character has trained against armed opponents and knows how to quickly disarm them.
description:
The character’s Martial Arts Close Combat attacks gain the following Trigger:

*[C] Disarming Attack*: After succeeding, the target drops a single item of your choice held in its hands. This attack’s damage flip receives a [-].

name: Fickle
narative: This character is easily distracted by just about anything, and she finds it hard to make up her mind.
description: The character gains a [+] on any Skill she hasn’t used that session, but it costs 1 extra experience point whenever she attempts to raise a Skill higher than 2 ranks.

name: Frozen Heart
narative: For whatever reason, this character has been marked by the Tyrant December as one of His own. With the first touch of December’s power, the character’s heart literally becomes frozen solid, and over time it may become pure ice. Powerful emotions become a rarity, and it is very easy for the character to overcome panic.
description: The character becomes immune to Horror Duels and the **Paralyzed** Condition.

name: Gaussian Logic Engine
narative: This character has been fitted with a Gaussian Logic Engine, allowing it to “think” in ways otherwise foreign to most machines (and even some people).
description: The character reduces its highest Physical Aspect by 1, but may then raise a Mental Aspect by 1, to a maximum Aspect Value of 4.

name: Heavy Mount and Bracing
narative: This character is fitted with braces and supports that allow it to mount a heavy weapon onto its body.
description: The character may attach a weapon with the Heavy rule to their weapon mount with five minutes of work; it is then considered to be braced to a weapon mount. The character may use the (1) Ready Weapon Action as a (0) Action when readying this attached weapon.

name: Improvised Parts
narative: This character has learned to use discarded pieces of scrap to improve her Constructs.
description: When creating a Construct, the character gains an additional number of Construct Points equal to her Intellect Aspect.

name: Inscription
narative: This character possesses the steady hand and penmanship necessary to inscribe new spells into a Grimoire.
description: The character may add up to two total Magia and/or Immuto to a single Grimoire in her possession. These Magia or Immuto need not be ones that the character has in another Grimoire; Any special rules which apply to the Grimoire also apply to these new Magia and/or Immuto.

name: Interface
narative: This character is capable of rapidly interfacing with other Constructs, allowing it to quickly transfer large amounts of data in a manner that Constructs can easily understand.
description:
The character gains the following Trigger to all Social Duels:

*[t] Interface*: After succeeding against a Construct, gain 1 additional Margin of Success.

name: Leg Modification
description:
This character’s legs can be swapped out for different models. Replacing the legs requires 30 minutes of work and a successful Artefacting or Engineering duel against TN 12(which may be made by the character or someone else assisting them). Grants one of several modifications until the Talent is used again. If successful, the character gains one of the options below until it uses this Talent again.

• Standard: No adjustment
• Chargers: Gain +2 Charge and -1 Walk
• Light Alloy: Gain + 1 Walk and -1 Wound
• Treads: Gain Unimpeded, -1 Walk, and -2 Charge
• Hinged: Character may take the Drop Prone and Stand Up Actions as (0) Actions but may not take the Run Action.

name: Lightning Rod
narative: When magic hits this character, it hits her hard. This has happened enough times that she’s prepared to leap out of the way at a moment’s notice.
description: The character gains a [+] on any duels made to resist Spells or Manifested Powers, but when targeted by an enemy’s Spell or Manifested Power, the enemy can add a single suit of their choice to the final duel total.

name: Metal on Metal
narative: This character has a number of thick metal plates that are not integral to its function. They make for great improvised shields when attacked.
description:
The character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

Df ([t]) *Metal on Metal*: Reduce the damage caused by an Attack Action by 2, to a minimum of 1.

name: Mostly Blind
narative: This character has difficulty seeing things, but she’s learned to bull her way through most challenges to make up for it.
description: The character gains a [+] on Close Combat attacks but a [-] on Ranged Combat attacks.

name: Mountaineer
narative: This character is almost a human spider, able to climb nearly vertical surfaces with the barest minimum of handholds.
description: When climbing a surface, this character moves at full Walk speed rather than half her Walk speed. She gains a [+] to Athletics Challenges to climb and moves 2 yards per Margin of Success (rather than 1 yard).

name: Mow Down
narative: There’s something satisfying about mowing down your enemies in a hail of bullets.
description: When this character makes a Ranged Combat attack with a Heavy Gun, she may use 2 AP instead of 1 AP to gain [+][+] on the attack flip. The character may not Cheat Fate on this attack. This attack uses three times as many bullets as normal.

name: Queensbury Rules
narative: This character is an adherent to the Marquess of Queensberry rules, the code of generally accepted rules in the sport of boxing. Such a focus makes her a true boxer, leagues above the hoodlums who just punch and kick each other until someone falls down.
description:
The character gains the following Trigger on her Pugilism Close Combat attacks:

*[r] Win By Knockout*: After damaging, the target takes the Drop Prone action.

name: Quick
narative: This character responds to things faster than most, ensuring that she’s never caught unaware.
description: The character gains a [+] to any Challenges made to resist [p] and takes 1 less damage from [p] and [b] effects (to a minimum of 1 damage).

name: Rebound
narative: If you throw it just right, sometimes you can bounce a thrown weapon off one enemy and into another.
description:
The character gains the following Trigger on her Thrown Weapons Ranged Combat attacks:

*[m] Rebound*: After damaging, you may deal 1/2/3 damage to another target within 3 yards of the original target.

name: Riposte
narative: This character is capable of quickly counterattacking with her sword after parrying an enemy’s attack.
description:
The character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

Df *([r][m]) Riposte*: After a Close Combat attack fails against this character, this character deals the damage of one of her readied sword or blade weapons to the attacker. This damage flip receives a [-].

name: Self Sufficient
narative: When no one likes you, it’s a lot easier to figure out how to do things on your own.
description: This character gains +1 Willpower but cannot take the Assist Action and cannot voluntarily take part in Ongoing Challenges alongside other characters (though the Fatemaster may still force it).

name: Slow Learner
narative: When this character was young, everyone thought she was as dumb as a brick. Fortunately, smarts aren’t everything.
description: This character gains +1 to an Aspect of her choice. During the Epilogue step, the Fatemaster chooses which Skill the character will advance in, rather than the player.

name: Steel Wall
narative: This character is essentially a large block of mobile armor.
description: At the end of the character’s turn, if it did not take any Move or Charge Actions, the character gains Armor +1 until the start of its next turn and provides Hard Cover to characters with a Height equal to or lower than its own.

name: Street Fighter
narative: This character has spent enough time on the streets to realize that sometimes, it’s the guy with the dirtiest trick who gets to see another sunrise.
description:
The character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

*Df ([C]) Street Fighter*: After a Close Combat attack fails against this character, if this character is wielding no weapons, this character deals 1/2/3 damage to the attacker. This damage flip may not be cheated.

name: Stubborn
narative: Sometimes, it pays to be a bit pig-headed and refuse to accept anything but what you want.
description: This character gains a [+] on all Willpower duels but a [-] on all Convince Challenges.

name: Sycophant
narative: When you’re this awesome, it’s hard to get people to leave you alone. The character has a loyal hanger-on that will do most things asked of them so long as the request is not obviously suicidal.
description: The character chooses a Peon or Minion level Commoner to be her sycophant. The sycophant is a subordinate under the Fatemaster’s control. If it dies or is abandoned, a new one may appear after a few days in a populated area.

name: Taskmaster
narative: It’s sometimes difficult to properly motivate someone, but this character knows that where there’s a whip, there’s a way.
description: When a friendly character within 3 yards takes an action involving a non-Social Skill, they may suffer 1 damage to gain a [+] to the resulting Challenge. This Talent may only be used while this character is wielding a Flexible weapon.

name: Threading the Needle
narative: This character is skilled at putting her arrows exactly where she needs them to go.
description: When making an Archery Ranged Combat attack, this character may ignore other characters when determining line of sight and does not randomize her target when firing into an engagement.

name: Torso Modifications
description:
This character’s torso can be swapped out for different models. Replacing the torso takes 30 minutes and a successful Artefacting or Engineering duel against TN 14 (which may be made by the character or someone else assisting them).If successful, the character gains one of the options below until it uses this Talent again.

• Standard: No adjustments.
• Reinforced Armor: The character’s Armor may reduce damage to 0, but it suffers -2 to its Charge Aspect.
• Lightweight Chest Plate: The character gains +1 Defense and -1 Wound.
• Parade Armor: The character lowers its Defense and Armor by 1 (to a minimum of 0) but gains a [+] to Social Challenges.

name: Tough as Nails
narative: This character has taken a beating or two in her time, but she never let it slow her down.
description: Critical Effect flips made against the character receive a [-].

name: Unceasing
narative: This character took the story of the tortoise and the hare to heart, believing that slow and steady will win the race.
description: Once per turn, the character may discard a Twist Card to take a Walk action without spending any AP.

name: Addict
displayedReqs: Requirement: The character must have the Brilliance Condition (any value).
narative: This character has become addicted to Brilliance.
description:
While this character has the Brilliance Condition, she gains the following Tactical Action:

(0) Drawn to the Light: This character may move up to its Walk Aspect towards a character with the Brilliance Condition and must end this movement as close to the target as possible.

name: Bent Fate
displayedReqs: Requirement: Fated, 2 or more completed Destiny Steps
narative: For whatever reason, this character has caused something to happen that has warped her destiny into something new.
description: This character may remove two cards from her Twist Deck.

name: Bloated Stench
narative: This character is possessed of an odor that only grows worse when she becomes wounded.
description: When this character suffers damage from a [y] attack, the attacker suffers 1 damage after resolving the attack.

name: Blood Scent
displayedReqs: Requirement: The character must have the Blood Sickness Condition (any value).
narative: As the Black Blood spreads through the character's body, the scent of blood begins to have a more stimulating effect on her. Even the smallest wound will cause her heart rate to quicken and her mouth to salivate, and her reflexes go into overdrive whenever a living creature is killed near her.
description: If a Living character is killed within 1 yard of this character while she has the Blood Sickness Condition, she may discard a card to gain the **Fast** Condition.

name: Brain Surgery
description:
The character can transplant the brain of a corpse (or soon-to-be corpse) into a Flesh Construct or special jar (see Under Quarantine pg. 95) with an hour of work. The donor must have the Living Characteristic, and the brain counts as one body part when determining how many a character may replace. The Flesh Construct gains the donor's Skill ranks (replacing the Flesh Construct's Skills, if the donor's Skills are higher) and her Mental Aspects. Some elements of the donor's personality and memories may carry over to the Flesh Construct.

If the transplanted brain belongs to a Fated, the Fatemaster should consider allowing the character to become a Stitched in control of her new body. The character will retain its Mental Aspects and Skills as noted above, as well as any Talents she possesses (which are normally lost when a non-Fated character has her brain transferred into a Flesh Construct).

name: Burning Man
displayedReqs: Requirement: This character must have had the **Burning +5** or greater Condition resolve against her.
narative: This character has been engulfed in flames but has come through on the other side all the stronger for it. Something happened deep inside her, something magical, and now the flames that would have killed her leap up in her defense, burning those who would harm her.
description:
This character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

**Df/Wp ([t]) Smoldering Heart:** After this character succeeds, the attacker gains the **Burning +1** Condition.

name: Ceaseless Advance
narative: This character keeps on going no matter how bleak things are.
description: At the end of each round of Dramatic Time, if this character does not have any Twist Cards in her hand, she may take a (1) Walk Action.

name: Evil Eye
narative: This character possesses the Evil Eye, a powerful curse that is cast via a malevolent glare.
description:
This character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

**Df/Wp ([C]) Evil Eye**: After this character succeeds, the attacker gains the Cursed +1 Condition with a Taboo against attacking this character.

name: Fate's Messenger
displayedReqs: Requirement: Fated, 2 or more completed Destiny Steps
narative: As this character's fate unwinds before her, she finds that she is sometimes able to adjust its path, though doing so causes intense migraines and nosebleeds.
description: Whenever this character would discard a Twist card for any reason other than Cheating Fate, she may instead choose to suffer 2 damage; this damage may not be reduced or prevented.

name: Favored of Fate
displayedReqs: Requirement: Fated, 1 or more completed Destiny Steps
narative: Surrendering to the whims of fate can be a terrifying experience, but some characters find peace in knowing that their destiny has already been written. Others fight back against their destiny, imposing their own will upon fate, no matter the cost.
description: When this character draws a Twist Card, she may suffer 2 damage to immediately discard it and draw again; this damage may not be reduced or prevented.

name: Ferocious Loyalty
narative: This character is able to inspire her minions to perform great acts of heroism (or villainy).
description: When this character uses the (1) Order Action to command a subordinate character, this character may discard a card to give her subordinate a [+] to all Skill Challenges (including attacks) it makes for the duration of its turn.

name: Final Repose
narative: Whether due to an encounter with a necromancer or just paranoia about her enemies returning from the dead, this character has learned how to finish off her enemies in such a way as to make sure they won’t come back.
description: When this character kills another character, she may choose to instantly render her target’s remains unfit to be reanimated into an Undead (or any other type of) creature.

name: From Beyond
displayedReqs: Requirement: Must have the Haunted Condition.
narative: This character has made peace with the spirits that surround her. While still not pleasant, the spirits of the departed see the character as a kindred spirit and do what they can to help her.
description: This character is immune to the mechanical symptoms of the Haunted Condition. Additionally, if she fails a Notice or Scrutiny Challenge, she may lower her Haunted Condition value by exactly 1 (to a minimum of 0) to reflip the duel.

name: Glimpse Fate's Plan
narative: This character has caught a fleeting glimpse of not just her own fate, but the fate of the entire world. It’s difficult to make sense of this vision, but the lingering memories of that moment make the Fated more prepared for what is to come... even if she does have to deal with frequent episodes of deja vu.
description: This character's maximum Control Hand size is increased by +1. This character may take this Talent multiple times, and its effects stack.

name: Hole in the Chest
description:
This character has a hole in her chest. This character is unable to pass as a Living creature while this hole is visible, but she gains the following Defensive Trigger:

**Df ([m]) Through the Hole:** After failing against a Ranged Combat attack, the attack deals no damage to this character.

name: Hunter
narative: This character has spent enough time hunting the beasts of the wild to know how best to bring them down.
description: She gains a [+] to damage flips made against Beasts.

name: I Thought You Died?!
description: The next time this character is killed — no matter how grisly or final it may have been — this character returns to life (or unlife, if the character was previously Undead) and rejoins her companions at some point during the next day. This resurrection occurs "off camera," though the character may sport some bandages or superficial injuries as a result of her "near death" experience. This Talent may only be used once; any subsequent deaths affect the character normally.

name: It's Raining Scrip
narative: For whatever reason, this character just seems to have a knack for making money.
description: This character gains 5 scrip when she takes this Talent. When she gains scrip from any non-Fated source — whether as part of a reward for a completed adventure, gambling winnings, or just looting the pockets of the dead — she gains an additional +20% scrip.

name: Killswitch
description:
This character is able to implant explosives within an Undead or Construct subordinate with a TN 11 Explosives Challenge and 2 scrip of raw materials (which are lost if she fails the Explosives Challenge). The subordinate gains the following ability:

**Explosive Demise 2:** All characters within [p]2 suffer 2 damage when this character is killed.

name: Man's Best Friend
description:
This character has earned the devotion of a canine companion. Living or Construct characters gain a Guard Dog (pg. 173), while Undead characters gain a Canine Remains (pg. 173).

If the canine companion is killed, this character may discard a card during Narrative Time to attract a new canine companion. The canine companion is a subordinate character and may be commanded with the (1) Order Action.

If this character has the Animal Companion Talent, the canine companion benefits from any Talents that grant bonuses to Animal Companions (but does not otherwise count as an Animal Companion).

name: Mechanized Undead
narative: This character is a twisted amalgam of unchained science and dark necromancy, almost as much machine as undead.
description: She gains the Construct Characteristic and may purchase Talents as if she were an Invested character.

name: Medical Genius
narative: Whether due to a prestigious medical education, experimentation on dead bodies, or just plain natural talent, this character is regarded as a genius in the field of medicine and healing.
description:
This character gains the following Trigger on all Doctor Challenges:

[t] *It's Not Lupus:* After succeeding, gain 1 additional Margin of Success.

name: Mind in the Sewer
narative: A lot of people think of the sewers as disgusting, but this character... alright, the sewers really are pretty disgusting, but familiarity breeds fondness, right?
description: This character is immune to the Blighted and **Infected** Conditions and ignores severe terrain penalties for moving through water.

name: Necrochemist
displayedReqs: Requirement: Alchemistry 3 or higher, Necromancy 2 or higher
narative: This character has learned how to imbue her chemical compounds with faint traces of necromantic energy, allowing them to affect the undead in much the same way they would affect the living.
description: When this character creates a compound (whether from the options presented on page 98 in *Under Quarantine* or from the Elixir of Life, Mystery Brew, Transformative Vigor, or Truth Serum Talents of the Chemist Pursuit), she may choose to have it affect Undead instead of Living characters.

name: Noxious Undead
narative: By using special chemical reagents, this character is able to imbue her Undead subordinates with lingering clouds of toxic gas, making for deadly (but stinky) minions.
description:
Undead characters this character creates gain the following ability:

**Noxious Cloud:** At the end of this character's turn, all characters without Noxious Cloud within [p]1 of this character gain the **Poison +1** Condition.

name: Pyromaniac
displayedReqs: Requirement: Must have applied 10 or more ranks of the **Burning** Condition to her enemies during a single combat.
narative: This character is a fan of flame (and enjoys fanning flames, too).
description: When this character gives the **Burning** Condition to another character, that character gains an additional **Burning +1**.

name: Reattach
narative: This character's limbs might fall off from time to time, but that just means that she knows how best to stick them back into place.
description:
At the start of this character's turn during Dramatic Time, she may heal up to 2 damage and gain the following Condition until the end of Dramatic Time: “**Fragile +1**: Damage flips against this character gain [+]”.

In addition, this character can heal any Amputated Critical Effect on her arms or legs by holding the severed limb against her stump for one minute, at which point the limb reattaches.

name: Reset Fate
narative: While some people are content to take whatever fate gives them, this character tries to stay one step ahead of her destiny.
description: At the end of Dramatic Time, before this character discards any unwanted Twist Cards, she may reshuffle her Twist Card discard pile back into her Twist Deck.

name: Rusts n' Oils
displayedReqs: Requirement: Alchemistry 3 or higher, Engineering 2 or higher
narative: This character has learned how to create chemical compounds and acids that are capable of affecting Constructs and other mechanical creatures in a manner similar to how other chemicals affect living creatures.
description: When this character creates a compound (whether from the options presented on page 98 in *Under Quarantine* or from the Elixir of Life, Mystery Brew, Transformative Vigor, or Truth Serum Talents of the Chemist Pursuit), she may choose to have it affect Constructs instead of Living characters.

name: Sadistic Streak
narative: This character draws strength from the cruelty she inflicts upon those under her command.
description: At the start of this character's turn, she may deal 1 damage to one of her subordinate characters within 3 yards to push up to 3 yards in any direction.

name: Shambling Gait
narative: This character will never be fast... but at least she tries, right?
description: She gains +1 to either all Physical Aspects or all Mental Aspects, but gains the **Slow** Condition at the start of each of her turns during Dramatic Time.

name: Spiritual Sensitivity
displayedReqs: Requirement: The character must have failed an Unconsciousness Challenge while at negative Wounds.
narative: Perhaps it was a near-death experience or just a bump on the head; whatever the reason, this character is now able to sense the presence of spirits around her.
description:
This character gains the following Tactical Action:

 (0) Sense Spirits: This character becomes aware of the presence of any characters with the Spirit Characteristic within 10 yards (even if they are invisible or hidden).

name: Spelunker
narative: Time spent underground - whether in the caverns beneath Malifaux or back on Earth - has made this character comfortable with moving around in enclosed areas.
description: This character gains a [t] on all Navigation, Track, and Wilderness duels made underground. Furthermore, she is immune to the **Claustrophobia** Condition (pg. 44).

name: Touched by the Grave Spirit
displayedReqs: Requirement: The character has either died or been at -10 Wounds or below.
narative: As she hovered on the brink of death, a powerful spirit took notice of this character, toughening her body and making her stronger (and likely giving her some strange dreams in the process).
description: When this character fails an unconsciousness challenge, she heals 1/2/3 damage. She still remains unconscious until the Fatemaster determines otherwise (generally until the end of Dramatic Time or until she is revived with the Doctor Skill).

name: Twisted Mind
narative: This character's psyche is twisted by madness and torment, and anyone touching her mind invariably recoils in pain.
description:
This character gains the following Trigger:

**Wp ([C]) Twisted Mind:** After this character succeeds, the attacker suffers 2 damage.

name: Warding Gestures
narative: This character has a weak body that is prone to injury. In order to protect herself, she has learned a smattering of warding gestures that can be used to protect her from harm.
description: When this character suffers damage, she may discard a Twist Card to reduce the damage by 2.

name: Well-Preserved
narative: This character's body is intact and preserved enough for her to easily pass as a Living character in polite company.
description: The TNs of Scrutiny Challenges made to determine if this character is Undead are increased by +2.

name: Swagger
narative: It may take this character longer to get wherever she is going, but the self-confident way she gets there makes all the difference.
description: At the end of this character's turn, she gains the **Defensive +1** Condition if she declared only Walk Actions during her turn.

name: A Gremlin's Luck
narative: This character's lack of common sense has led her to rely upon her natural luck to carry her through life. Fortunately, it mostly seems to work for her... mostly.
description: When performing a duel, this character may discard a card or suffer 1 damage to Cheat Fate with the top card of the Fate Deck.

name: All the Big Words
narative: This personage has taken to peppering her dialogue with a plethora of sesquipedal words. While this does make her sound perspicacious, it tends to discombobulate anyone aurally perceiving her dialogue, and perplex them withal.
description: If this character succeeds on a Social Skill Challenge during Narrative Time, the target of the Challenge gains the **Dazed** Condition for one minute. If the character achieves a Margin of Success on the challenge, every other character within listening distance gains the **Dazed** Condition for one minute.

name: Creative Refurbishment
displayedReqs: Requirement: Artefacting or Blacksmithing 3 or higher
description: With one hour of work, this character may remove a single property of a firearm (including range, capacity, damage, or one special rule) to add it to another firearm. Neither firearm can possess the Shoddy special rule. If the second firearm already possesses the chosen property (such as range, capacity, or damage), it gains the better of the two properties. The first firearm is destroyed in the process of modifying the second firearm, which then gains the Shoddy special rule.

name: Crude Sense of Humor
narative: There’s something terrible happening in this character’s insides… and she finds that to be downright hilarious in the right circumstances.
description:
This character gains the following Tactical Action:

(0) Pull My Finger: If this character is adjacent to a friendly character, that character may choose to pull this character's finger. If she does, all non-Gremlin characters within [p]2 of this character gain the **Poison +2** Condition. If this character chooses to discard a card when the adjacent character pulls her finger, any non-Gremlin characters within [p]2 also become **Slow**.

name: Dirty Cheater
narative: What this character lacks in willpower she makes up for in underhanded tricks.
description: Whenever this character Cheats Fate from her Twist Hand, she heals 1 damage after resolving the current Action.

name: Forgotten Lore
narative: It can often times be difficult to correctly identify one of Malifaux's many Grimoires. Some appear to be the thick tomes and books that most people expect to find, but others take on far stranger shapes, like talking skulls, runed weapons that whisper their secrets to their owner in their sleep, or even groups of standing stones that impart magical knowledge to anyone standing between them during the right phases of the moons.
description: This character has managed to successfully identify a powerful Grimoire and claim it for her own. The character gains a Grimoire with 3 Magia and 3 Immuto of her choice, but no more than 2 of these Magia can be of the same type of magic (i.e., Enchanting, Necromancy, etc.). Grimoires gained by this Talent tend toward uncommon appearances; the character is encouraged to work with the Fatemaster to determine her Grimoire's appearance.

name: From the Hip
narative: For whatever reason, this character just doesn't believe in carefully aiming her shots. Whether it's a reliance upon her instincts, special training, or just good old fashioned impatience, this character knows how to accurately aim a rifle at a moment's notice.
description: When making a Long Arms attack, this character may substitute Grace for Intellect when calculating her Acting Value.

name: Gremlin Engineering
narative: As every good Gremlin engineer knows, the trick to making a machine work is to hit it with a heavy wrench whenever it starts doing something you don't like. Machines are a lot like Gremlins in that aspect.
description: After one of this character's subordinate Constructs within engagement range of one of this character's melee weapons fails a Skill Challenge (including an attack), this character may make a damage flip against the Construct. If the Construct suffers at least 1 damage from this character's weapon, it may immediately reflip its result on the Challenge.

name: Helping Hand
narative: This character functions well as part of a group and is extremely good at keeping all of her allies operating at peak efficiency.
description: When this character takes the Assist Action during Dramatic Time, the target of her assistance gains the **Focused +1** Condition instead of the usual benefits of the Assist Action. When this character takes the Pass Action during Dramatic Time, she may add 1 to the Initiative Value of every other friendly character within [p]3.

name: Herding Squirrels
narative: Getting people to work together can be difficult, and that goes double for when those people are a pack of drunken idiots who refuse to acknowledge that the character is their supervisorThrough trial and error, this character has figured out that it's less about giving orders and more about just keeping everyone moving in the same direction as she hopes for the best.
description: This character may use a (1) Order Action to command a subordinate character controlled by another friendly character, with its controller's permission. A subordinate character may only take one turn per round, no matter how many (1) Order Actions it receives.

name: Hyperactive
narative: While the standard portrayal of a Gremlin in the eyes of a human mostly involves a drunken green monster lazing around in a tree with a shoddy banjo, that's only partially true. Once a Gremlin gets worked up about something, it can be difficult to get her to calm back down... and this character is no exception.
description: At the start of this character's turn, she may suffer 1 damage to remove the **Slow** Condition from herself, or 2 damage to remove the **Paralyzed** Condition. This damage cannot be reduced.

name: Hysterical Fury
narative: This character isn’t very hardy, and she knows it. When she becomes wounded, she enters a manic frenzy, fighting desperately to claw her way out from under the looming threat of death.
description: When this character has zero or fewer Wounds remaining, she gains [+] to her attack and damage flips.

name: I Got My Bro
description:
One of this character’s Gremlin relatives accompanies her on her adventures! If the character is not a Gremlin, this will probably raise more questions than answers, but the little fellow insists that the character is his sibling no matter how hard she tries to convince him otherwise. Use the Bayou Gremlin stats on pg. 159 to represent the character’s bro.
The Gremlin relative is a subordinate character and may be commanded with the (1) Order Action. If the Gremlin relative dies or the character abandons them, a new one will show up after a day spent in or near the Bayou.

name: Low Standards
narative: Most humans don't care too much for Gremlins; they're loud, craven, and prone to acts of suicidal stupidity and negligence. Even the Neverborn tend to consider Gremlins to be beneath their notice. This character, however, is an exception to the rule. Whether due to a shared rustic background, an appreciation for the simpler ways of life, or just a fondness for moonshine and some good banjo music, this character has befriended enough Gremlins to know just how to properly interact with them.
description: This character gains a [+] on Social Skill Challenges with Gremlins and counts as a Kin character for meeting the requirements of Talents.

name: Ooo, Glowy
narative: Protecting others from hostile magic isn't something that most people in Malifaux give much thought to doing - it's a dangerous world out there, and giving that protection away means that their own defenses are weakened - but this character has figured out a way to turn some of that extra magical energy to her benefit.
description: When this character uses a (1) Action to protect another character with Magical Shielding, the protected character also emits faint light, and her attacks ignore Armor and Hard to Wound for the duration of the Magical Protection.

name: Pickled
narative: The toxicity of Gremlin moonshine is often higher than most actual poisons, and a lifetime of pouring moonshine down her gullet has raised this character’s blood alcohol level to the point where most poisons just don’t stand a chance.
description: This character no longer suffers damage from the **Poison** Condition.

name: Pig Friend
narative: This character has a special bond with pigs that can only come from being ostracized and disliked by most of the non-pig things in the world.
description: At the start of her turn during Dramatic Time, if this character is within 1 yard of a friendly Pig, she heals 1 damage. Additionally, when a Pig character is determining the closest target that can be charged with its Stampede Trigger, this character is not considered to be a legal target.

name: Pounce
narative: When an enemy wanders into this character’s melee range, she lashes out with sudden and deadly fury.
description: When an enemy character ends a push or move within this character’s engagement range that is not part of a Walk or Charge Action, this character may immediately take a (1) AP Close Combat attack against the enemy character.

name: Quit Screwin' Around!
displayedReqs: Requirements: Kin, Intimidate 4 ranks or higher
narative: A few shouted threats are all it takes for this character to get everyone around her to stop showboating and just kill each other.
description:
This character gains the following Tactical Action:

(0) Quit Screwin’ Around: Until the start of this character’s next turn, characters within a6 of this character may not declare Triggers. If this character discards a card when she uses this Action, it does not affect her or her allies.

name: Role Model
narative: It's hard being such a great role model for the youngsters, but this character tries to live up to their expectations.
description: When this character takes the Assist Action to help a friendly Gremlin character, that character gains an additional [+] to their Challenge Duel. If this character discards a card when she takes the Assist Action, the friendly Gremlin may also add the suit of the discarded card to her final duel total.

name: School of Hard Knocks
narative: Even though this character isn't the sharpest knife in the drawer, she's spent some time in the world and learned the hard way that the world won't wait for her to catch up to it.
description: After this character fails a Challenge involving a Skill she has no ranks in, she gains 1 rank in that Skill until the end of the session.

name: Skulking Around
narative: This character might not be very quick on her feet, but she makes up for that by being a sneaky little git.
description: At the end of any round of Dramatic Time, if this character was not targeted by any enemy attacks, she may immediately move a number of yards up to her Walk Aspect.

name: Squeal
narative: Gremlins aren't particularly well known for suffering pain with dignity and grace. In fact, it's far more likely that a wounded Gremlin will squeal like a stuck pig upon receiving even the most minor of wounds.
description:
This character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

**Df [m] “Squeal!**”: After this character is damaged by an enemy Close Combat attack, push this character 4 yards directly away from the attacker.

name: Stalker
narative: Whether hunting in the Bayou or the Badlands, a skilled hunter knows that the best way to take down her prey is to isolate it from its allies before striking.
description: When attacking a target that is not within 4 yards of a character it considers to be friendly, this character deals +1 damage.

name: Versatile
narative: The Gremlins of the Bayou have always had a certain amount of cleverness to them. Once an idea to build or do something gets into their head, they can usually follow through on it with a certain amount of success, regardless of their lack of training, expertise, or even common sense.
description: After this character succeeds on a Challenge involving a Skill she has no ranks in, she may draw a Twist Card.

name: Advice for Idiots
narative: Despite her attempts, this character cannot always be there to share her advice with others. Thanks to the modern printing press, however, those in need can still benefit from her knowledge... provided that they pick up one of her affordably priced instruction manuals, of course!
description: This character can spend an hour and 2 scrip worth of raw materials to produce an instruction manual. When she produces the manual, she chooses a Skill that she possesses with one or more Ranks. From that point on, any other character in possession of the instruction manual may consult it as a (1) AP Action. For the rest of the consulting character’s turn, they are considered to be assisted by this character when using the Skill referenced by the manual, just as if this character had used the Assist Action to help her.

name: Aetheric Resonator
narative: Though difficult to create, aetheric resonators are quite useful to the aspiring artificer. These devices draw additional energy from the aether to augment the magic that animates a construct or pneumatic limb, extending the amount of time before the enchantment must be refreshed.
description: When this character builds a Construct or pneumatic limb, she may add aetheric resonator for 5 scrip, granting free Increased Duration Immuto to it's animation via Animate Construct Magia or Animate Limb Magia.

name: Badge of Office
displayedReqs: Requirements: Resilience -2 or lower, character must be a Guild employee or have the Infiltration Talent
narative: Whether it's luck, fate, or heavy-handed symbolism, attacks that would otherwise kill this character tend to bounce harmlessly off her Guild badge.
description:
Once per session after this character suffers damage from an enemy’s attack, she may discard a card to have the attack strike her badge of office. If she does so, the damage from the attack is reduced to 1, its Triggers and other effects are negated, and it does not cause any Critical Effects to this character.
This Talent cannot be used on attacks that have one or more [b] in their damage track.

name: Clumsy
narative: Most people can walk down the street without tripping over their own feet. This character is not one of those people.
description:
This character gains the following Defensive Trigger:

**Df [m] Trip Over Something**: If this character fails and is not Prone, she becomes Prone and the attack is considered to have missed this character unless the attacker achieved a Margin of Success.

name: Covering Fire
displayedReqs: Requirement: Chosen Skill Rank 2 or higher
narative: While there's certainly a time and a place for precise shooting, sometimes firing a salvo of bullets to frighten one's opponents works just as well.
description:
Choose a Ranged Combat Skill. This character gains the following Tactical Action:

(2) Covering Fire: Target an enemy within range and line of sight of a ranged weapon of the chosen type wielded by this character and expend three rounds of ammunition. If you do so, the enemy subtracts this character's ranks in the weapon’s Skill from its final duel totals until the start of this character's next turn.

name: Cultured
displayedReqs: Requirement: Chosen Skill Rank 2 or higher, Art 1 or higher
narative: Where brains and cleverness fail, this character's refined tastes and good manners prevail.
description: Choose a Social Skill. When this character makes a Challenge involving the chosen Skill, she may use her ranks in the Art Skill in place of her Mental Aspect.

name: Death Marshal Apostate
displayedReqs: Requirements: Guild Training (Death Marshals), Necromancy 2 or higher
narative:
The Death Marshals walk a fine line between righteousness and corruption, and invariably, some of them up drawing too heavily upon necromantic magic in the pursuit of their duties. While the Guild doesn’t completely disavow such characters (they were serving the Guild when they became “corrupted” by their duties, after all), they are certainly kept under a closer watch by the Judge.
This character is one of those unfortunate few who have crossed that line. As she draws upon her necromantic powers more and more frequently, her appearance will become progressively more sunken and emaciated, and it’s likely that her eyes will begin to glow an unearthly green color in the dark.
description:
Whenever this character successfully removes another character from reality (whether through the use of a Spell, Manifested Power, the *Get In The Box* Trigger granted by the Death Marshal Advanced Pursuit in the Core Rules, or some other source), the target suffers 2 damage that may not be reduced and this character heals 2 damage.

When this Talent is chosen, the character may change her Magical Theory to The Whisper. If she does not already have a Magical Theory, she gains The Whisper Magical Theory.

name: Devour Magic
narative: With a simple gesture, this character is able to siphon magical energy away from nearby spells, significantly weakening their strength.
description: Enemy characters within [a]3 of this character suffer a [-] on Magical Skill Challenges.

name: Everyman
narative: This character may not be all that strong, or all that fast, or even all that smart or charming, but when pushed too far, she fights back with everything she's got.
description: When this character's current Wounds are below 0, her attacks that deal damage deal +1 damage. If her current Wounds are below -10, this bonus increases to +2 damage.

name: Fickle Fate
narative: Fate can be a fickle mistress, but that doesn't mean she can't be courted. While the overall benefits of this attention can be debatable, it certainly allows this character to push her luck in interesting ways.
description: Before this character flips a Fate Card from the Fate Deck, she may declare “even” or “odd.” If the value of the flipped card matches the character’s prediction, its value is increased by +1. If not, its value is decreased by -1. If the character flips a Joker card, its value is not modified.

name: Guild Training
displayedReqs: Requirement: Character must be a Guild employee or have the Infiltration Talent, Bureaucracy 2 or higher
description:
This character gains a [+] on all Social Skill Challenges involving Guild personnel and an additional bonus depending upon the division that trained her:

**Amalgamation Office:** Halves cost of Constructs built using Guild resources and waives fees for modifications.

**Death Marshals:** Ignores Hard to Wound on Undead targets.

**Department of Public Relations:** Adds successes to Ongoing Challenges to inform or learn based on Charm.

**Elite Division:** May create a cover identity to gain a [+] to a chosen Skill.

**Guild Guard:** [+] on Social Challenges with non-Guild while in uniform and 'on duty'.

**Neverborn Hunters:** Immune to Black Blood damage.

**Witch Hunters:** May draw a card after resisting enemy Spell/Manifested Power.

This Talent may be taken multiple times, each time for a different division.

name: Idiot
narative: All it takes is a few minutes of conversation for someone to decide that this character is a bit slow on the uptake. While this might make it hard to get invited to fancy dinner parties, people tend to realize that this character isn't exactly playing with a full deck and don’t really hold it against her.
description: When this character fails a Social Skill Challenge, she generates no Margins of Failure, and unless this character was outright threatening, the character she is interacting with does not take offense to anything she might have said or realize that this character was attempting to manipulate her.

name: Implacable
narative: This character is particularly resistant to fear.
description: This character may add her ranks in the Centering Skill to the final total of any Horror Duel she makes.

name: Instinctive Grip
narative: This character doesn't fumble over weapons that she intends to throw. Her fingers just naturally seem to find the best way to hold the weapon.
description: This character may treat the (1) Ready Weapon Action as if it were a (0) Action when drawing a Thrown Weapon, and she may draw two Thrown Weapons instead of one.

name: I’ve Got Your Back
narative: This character isn’t particularly prone to manipulation or guile. When it comes to her friends and partners, she assumes that they will have her back through thick and thin, and that belief (however misguided it may be) drives her to do the same.
description: At the start of this character’s turn during Dramatic Time, she may nominate another friendly character within 1 yard. Until the start of this character’s next turn, the nominated character gains Armor +1 (without any reduction to their Defense) whenever they are within 1 yard of this character.

name: Lackadaisical
displayedReqs: Requirement: Speed -2 or lower or Sloth Vice
narative: This character tends to do things according to her own schedule. Whether lethargic, listless, or just plain lazy, this character still manages to get things done... eventually, at least.
description: When this character takes the Wait Action, the AP cost is equal to the AP cost of the named Action (instead of the AP cost of the named Action +1).

name: On My Mark
narative: When this character uses the Wait Action, she may name the Order Action as the Action she is waiting to perform.
description: When the Wait Action resolves, her Order Action takes effect and one of her subordinate characters may immediately take its turn. The subordinate character’s turn interrupts the named action before any duels (if any) take place. The subordinate character may still only receive one turn per round (unless it has **Reactivate**).

name: Partial Reload
narative: Sometimes, it’s more efficient to just slam a few bullets into the chamber instead of reloading the entire weapon. Fortunately, this character is fast enough to do just that.
description: When this character takes the Reload action with a weapon with a Capacity of 4 or greater, she may discard a card to take the Reload action as a (0) Action. If she does so, the weapon gains an amount of ammunition based upon the value of the discarded card: 1-5 gives the weapon 1 round of ammunition, 6-10 gives it 2 rounds, and 11+ gives it 3 rounds.

name: Patient
narative: This character knows how to take her time and wait for favorable circumstances. Even if her preparation doesn't pay off, in her mind, it was simply an investment that didn't pay out, rather than a mistake.
description: When this character takes the Wait Action, if the named Action does not occur before the start of this character’s next turn, she becomes **Fast** at the start of that turn.

name: Permanent Enchantment
description:
When this character uses the Enchant Item Talent to infuse magical energies into an item, she may choose to make the enchantment permanent. If she does so, the energies of the stored Spell do not dissipate when it is discharged; the enchanted item can be used over and over again without diminishing the magic stored inside it.

The character may only make a single enchantment permanent in this way, and the stored Spell counts against her maximum number of stored Spells for as long as the enchanted item exists.

This Talent may be chosen multiple times. Each time, the character may permanently enchant one additional item.

name: Personal Soulstone
displayedReqs: Requirements: Guild Training (any Division), character must be a Guild employee or have the Infiltration Talent
narative: The Guild tries very hard to keep Soulstones out of the hands of the general public, both out of a desire to control the Soulstone trade and a fear of what might happen if Soulstones fell into the hands of the wrong people (a fear that has, for the most part, shown itself to be entirely justified by the rise of the Arcanists and Resurrectionists). This character, however, has impressed the Guild with her diligence and service, and it has rewarded her with a personal Soulstone as a sign of its appreciation. These cut gems are often set into pieces of jewelry such as medals, necklaces, or cufflinks.
description:
This character gains a Soulstone of Lade 3 (Size 2 and Quality 1). If she loses or sells this Soulstone, it is not replaced (and the Guild will certainly have a few questions for her, if its agents find out).

This Talent may be chosen multiple times. Each time, the character gains another Soulstone.

name: Prejudice
narative: For whatever reason, this character develops grudges very easily, often making up her mind about a person’s flaws and inadequacies from the first moment they meet.
description:
At the start of Dramatic Time, this character may choose an enemy character and discard a card. If she does so, she gains [+] to all flips against the enemy character until the end of Dramatic Time.
If this character attempts to use a Social Skill other than Intimidate to influence the enemy character’s behavior at any point (even after Dramatic Time has finished), she gains no benefit from this Talent and instead suffers a [-] to her flip.

name: Quick to Act
narative: Rigorous training has turned this character’s body into a finely tuned machine. She’s in great shape, and all of that training has considerably improved her reaction time.
description: This character adds her ranks in Athletics to the final duel total of her Initiative flips.

name: Self-Preservation
narative: A lifetime of having to deal with bullies and enemies much stronger than herself has taught this character the value of fighting defensively. Even when fully on guard, she's always keeping an eye out for cover and making a dash for safety when the coast seems clear.
description: When this character takes the Defensive Stance Action, she may move up to two yards in any direction.

name: Side Arm
narative: The Guild emphasizes a "combined arms" approach to combat: its combat personnel, including the entirety of the Guild Guard, are required to carry both a melee weapon and a firearm while on duty. The quickest of these soldiers are capable of firing off pistol shots while engaged with other business, such as ordering troops, securing a barricade, or hacking their enemies apart with an axe. This character has chosen to emulate the impressive skill of these soldiers and can fire off accurate shots at a moment's notice.
description: On her turn, if this character has not made a Pistol attack that turn, she may make an attack with a readied Pistol as a (0) AP Action. This character may not make any further Pistol attacks on her turn.

name: Soulstone Healer
narative: This character is particularly adept at channeling the magical energy contained in a Soulstone.
description: When this character uses the Absorb Soul property of a Soulstone to heal herself or another character, the target heals 3/4/5 damage and removes a lasting Critical Effect.

name: Steady Advance
narative: In combat, momentum is everything. With a few quick shouts, this character can reorganize her troops into a new formation without having to explain the greater plan to them. Like extensions of her own body, her troops fall into place as expected, allowing their commander to focus upon more important tasks.
description: At the end of this character’s turn, any of her unengaged subordinate characters that did not receive a (1) Order Action may move a number of yards equal to half their Walk Aspect.

name: Study Opponent
narative: This character knows that an enemy is only as strong as their weakest point. She's always scanning her opponents for weakness and searching for the best avenue of attack.
description: When this character declares an attack against an opponent, she may discard a card. If she does so, each time she makes an attack against that opponent, she may choose whether the opponent resists the attack with Defense or Willpower. This bonus lasts until the end of Dramatic Time.

name: Subtle Magic
narative: Magic often rewards those with strong personalities and iron determination. While this character is, unfortunately, not one of those people, she is quite familiar with self-doubt, cowardice, indolence, and timidity. By tailoring her spells to exploit those weaknesses, she can often catch her opponents off-guard by attacking their minds and bodies in unexpected ways.
description: After this character successfully casts a Spell or Manifested Power that uses the Tenacity Aspect, she generates a number of additional Margins of Success equal to her negative Tenacity Aspect (i.e., one Margin of Success at Tenacity -1, two Margins of Success at Tenacity -2, and so on).

name: Unrelenting
narative: No matter the injury or pain, this character does not abandon a mission… or a fight.
description: At the start of this character’s turn during Dramatic Time, if she is not **Slow** or **Paralyzed**, she may choose to become **Slow**. If she does so, she heals 1 damage.

name: Craft Grimoire
displayedReqs: Requirement: One Magical Skill 4 or higher
narative: Malifaux is a place filled with magic. For those with a voracious appetite for study, creation, and learning the arcane, there is no limit to how much knowledge a single person can acquire… so long as they understand the costs and risks associated with undertaking such a task.
description: This character begins to craft her own unique Grimoire, which may take whatever form she wishes. The first time this Talent is taken, add one Magia of the appropriate Magical Skill requirement this character has to the Grimoire. This must be a Magia she has previously encountered or has otherwise spent the time learning how to produce herself. Each additional time this General Talent is chosen, this character can add one additional Magia and any one Immuto to the Grimoire. Only she may attune to this Grimoire; it is useless if any other character tries to utilize it. Finally, this Grimoire is special in that the Fated character that creates it can remain attuned to both it and one additional Grimoire; she is able to cast Magia and Immuto from both.

name: Soulstone Efficiency
narative: Soulstones are strange and mysterious things. This character has learned how to divide up the energy within to maximize the benefits received from a Soulstone.
description: When expending a Charge from a Soulstone, this character may select two of the benefits from using a Soulstone rather than just one.

name: Neverborn Anthropology
narative: Human historians have spent decades trying to decipher the complex and esoteric Neverborn language. Its harsh runic script is difficult to translate even for the most seasoned anthropologist, but long hours of consulting assembled tomes and academic texts (or undergoing tutelage from a Neverborn elder) have left this character with the knowledge necessary to interpret what the eldest Nephilim wrote long ago.
description: This character can read and decipher the ancient Neverborn language and its runic text; while its meaning might be slightly unclear (even to native Neverborn), the general concept and intention of the words is understandable. She is also able to (very roughly) communicate with the Neverborn in their native tongue.

name: Fortunate Familiarity
narative: Some situations always seem familiar, and this character has figured out when to identify, and take advantage of, those little chances at luck.
description: Declare a number 1-13 when this character takes this Talent. Any time she includes a card with that value in her acting duel total, she may add a single suit of her choice to that duel.

name: Cursed Existence
narative: This character’s very life seems cursed. Wherever she goes, bad luck seems to follow. Fortunately, this character has learned to rely on this ideology of “things can always be worse” and has gotten quite good at preparing for the most terrible outcome.
description: If this character would ever have any of her Aspects or Derived Aspects’ values reduced (aside from Wounds), she may choose to not lower those values.

name: Sacrificial Pawn
displayedReqs: Requirement: Charm -3 or less, 3+ Gifts of Darkness
