narative: This character’s very body is an arcane vessel that provides shamans and mages with the power they need to fuel their spells. The pain she suffers is part of life; she was born for that station, and so shall fulfill it whenever asked.
description: When this character suffers damage, she can count as suffering one additional point of damage for resolving any Triggers, effects, or similar actions. She does not actually suffer this additional point of damage (i.e. a character suffering 2 damage could count as suffering 3 damage, but would still only suffer 2 damage).

name: A Spot of Sunshine
displayedReqs: Requirement: Charm 2 or higher, Tenacity -2 or lower
narative: This character is surprisingly cheerful, and her enthusiasm tends to spread towards everything she does.
description: This character gains [+] to all non-Magical Skill Challenges or duels with the Charm Associated Aspect.

name: Aetheric Calibrator
narative: Constructs rarely use magic as a weapon or for defensive purposes, but that has started to change in recent years. Aetheric calibrators are a mechanical representation of counter-spelling, which collects incoming magical streams and sends them back to the caster… usually with painfully messy results.
description: When this character is targeted by a Spell or Manifested Power, it may discard any number of cards from its hand. The attacker suffers 1/2/3 damage based on the value of each discarded card. Then, this character can draw 1 card for each value or suit its discarded cards matched with the attacking character’s final acting value.

name: Plead Insanity
displayedReqs: Requirement: Must have had the **Crazy +4** or greater Condition
narative: Madness can be a surprising defense against the horrors of everyday life. There’s a cost, of course, but this character’s head is filled with enough craziness to foot that bill.
description: This character may discard two cards to gain Armor equal to half of her current **Crazy** Condition, rounded up, for one round. At the start of her next turn, she gains **Crazy +1.**

name: Vascular Studies
narative: Whether educated in the field of medicine or simply driven by morbid curiosity, this character knows where to best strike a vein or artery... and how best to patch them back up.
description: The TN of the Use Doctor Action against any injury this character causes is increased by +2. If this character takes the Use Doctor Action, the TN is reduced by -1.

name: Hatred of the Dead
narative: The Neverborn have a deep hatred for those who are undead and redouble their efforts to see every walking corpse torn apart and returned to final rest.
description: When resolving an attack against a character with the Undead Characteristic, this character may discard a card to increase the damage she deals on an attack by exactly one degree (Weak to Moderate to Severe). The damage cannot be increased beyond Severe.

name: Rend Steel
narative: The constructs and worked metals of mankind are no match for this character's strength.
description:
This character gains the following Trigger on all non-Flexible Close Combat attacks:

[r] Rending: After causing a Moderate or Severe Critical Effect, this character may elect to destroy one piece of Armor the target is wearing instead of resolving the Critical Effect. If this would not be possible (such as when targeting a Construct), the target instead permanently lowers its **Armor** by +1 until it can be repaired.

name: Running and Screaming
displayedReqs: Requirement: At least one Mental Aspect -1 or less
narative: Sometimes the best reaction to seeing something frightening is to turn and run as fast as possible. Flailing and shouting is optional.
description: After this character resolves the effects from a failed Horror Duel, she can choose to immediately Push her Walk value in yards directly away from the character that caused the Horror Duel.

name: Nocturnal
narative: When the lights of Malifaux City wink out, there are those who take this time to stretch their legs and begin their day.
description: When in a dark environment or during nighttime (normally 9pm-6am), this character gains +1 to all non-Ranged Combat or Close Combat Skill Challenges she takes.

name: Deeper Connection
displayedReqs: Requirement: Magical Skill 1 or higher, 2 or more completed Destiny Steps
narative: Once every generation, someone might be born with a slightly stronger connection to the aether. Their soul collects tiny fragments of magic over a long period of time. Mages can call this energy forth to empower their spells like others would use a Soulstone.
description: Once every week, this character can utilize one of the benefits of expending a charge from a Soulstone, resolving its effects as though she had used a normal Soulstone. This can be used in conjunction with normal Soulstones but cannot be recharged in any fashion other than waiting 7 days.

name: Identify Magic
narative: To this character, necromancy is slimy, cold, and bitter; prestidigitation is foggy, airy, and smooth; sorcery is colorful, violent, and energetic; enchanting is isolated, constant, and clean. These feelings register whenever a particularly strong source of magic happens by.
description: This character is automatically aware of all currently active magical effects that she comes within 2 yards of; while she may not know exactly what the spell does, this character can roughly ascertain its effects. Additionally, she knows all special effects and Magia a Grimoire might have, and does not need to attune to the Grimoire to know these qualities.

name: Grounded
narative: The nights in Malifaux are filled with terrors, but this character has learned to stand firm and face whatever dwells within.
description: Once per day, during Dramatic Time, this character may declare she is resisting the mental tricks of the Neverborn. She must select a character with the Nightmare or Woe trait that is currently taking their turn. For the remainder of that activation, she ignores the Terrifying Talent from the chosen Neverborn, and counts their Rank Value as 1 when targeting this character with any action that is resisted by Willpower.

name: Murder Methodology
narative: Most Neverborn consider murder to be something of an art form. Ensuring one attacks quickly and efficiently is crucial to making it out of a fight alive.
description: If this character deals a Critical Effect that affects a specific body part, she may flip a second card from the Fate Deck and choose where the attack lands based on either of the flipped suits. If the same suit is flipped on the second card, this character can choose where her attack lands.

name: Scaredy-Cat
narative: Cowering isn’t always the worst option, as it makes this character less of an immediate threat. At least, that’s what she tells herself.
description: If this character fails a Horror Duel, she immediately gains **Defensive +1.**

name: Black Blood Scars
displayedReqs: Requirement: Survived a Nephilim attack at negative Wounds
narative: It is rare to survive a Nephilim attack. Those that do keep the scars forever. Pain, whether mental or physical, helps this character focus her attacks so each one deals as much damage to Malifaux’s denizens as possible.
description:
This character reduces the TN of all Willpower and Horror Duels Nephilim characters inflict by 1. She also gains the Critical Strike Trigger on all Ranged Combat and Close Combat attacks made against Nephilim characters. If she already has the Critical Strike Trigger, this character adds [r] to those final duel totals instead.

[r] *Critical Strike*: When damaging, deal 1 additional damage for each [r] in the final duel total.

name: Necromantic Tithe
narative: Sometimes this character just needs to snuff out the final spark of unlife to top off her own necromantic chalice.
description: This character may destroy one friendly subordinate Undead character as a (0) Action to gain **Fast**.

name: Sleepless Elite
displayedReqs: Requirement: Living Characteristic, Tenacity 2 or higher
narative: A small sect of the population can function perfectly well on very little rest. Called the “sleepless elite”, they burn the midnight oil and rise with the dawn to get more waking hours in their day.
description: This character only requires half the normal amount of sleep, about 3 hours, to avoid becoming fatigued and gaining the **Dazed** Condition. If she would ever gain the **Dazed** Condition, she may take a TN 14 Centering Challenge. On a success, she does not gain **Dazed.**

name: Coded Speech
narative: The Ten Thunders use many different methods to conceal their communications with one another. A favored tactic is using flowery and confusing language to hide true meaning. By establishing code words, grammatical rules, and associating different nouns with new names or ideas, anyone can have a conversation without anyone else knowing what they’re saying.
description:
This character creates a special coded language, which only she can understand. This might include hand movements, unique phrases, metaphors, and other confusing elements of speech. Regardless of how it functions, nobody else will be able to understand this character without first passing a TN 16 Literacy Challenge after observing her communicate in this code for at least a cumulative hour of time.
When taking this Talent, a character may select another character she knows with Literacy 2 or higher. Both characters can communicate fluently in the code. Other characters taking this Talent can select a preexisting code they have been introduced to; if they do so, they are treated as understanding it as well.

name: Soul Vessel
displayedReqs: Requirement: Construct Characteristic, 1 or more completed Destiny Steps
narative: It has long been theorized that the Soulstones used to power constructs can leave imprints of the soul’s personality on the machine. The Ten Thunders have taken this a step further. They bless mechanical bodies and prepare them to be vessels for spirits pulled back from the aether. This process gives the construct the ability to store additional souls within its body, and use them to increase its own power.
description:
This character is able to act like a reservoir for souls, whether through alterations to her metallic body or enchantments placed upon her through ceremonies. She is always treated as having a Soulstone; because it is simply a web of magical connections, this is not an actual Soulstone, and so cannot be removed, stolen, or otherwise lost. It must still contain a charge to use any Soulstone effects. Each completed Destiny Step after the first increases the number of charges her “Soulstone” can carry by +1, to a maximum of 3.
If a Living character dies within [a]8 of this character, she may immediately choose to charge her own “Soulstone” instead of allowing someone closer to do it. If multiple characters have this Talent, the one with the lowest number of charges has priority when recharging the “Soulstone”. If tied for equal Charges, characters should take an Opposed Tenacity Duel to determine who receives the Charge.

name: Speed is Safety
narative: This character is capable of moving at impossible speed... Hitting such a fast-moving target is difficult at the best of times, but this character avoids strikes with the ease of someone playing a novel game of tag.
description:
When being targeted by a character whose Initiative is at least 4 lower than hers, this character gains Defense +1 until the end of the acting character’s turn.
A character loses all benefits from this Talent if her Armor value is +2 or higher.

name: Cultural Crafting
narative: Goods and unique items from other cultures are often imitated and sold Earthside and across Malifaux. Nobody can make them exactly like those taught by a mentor bearing wisdom passed down through the ages. This knowledge also gives greater insight; a difficult process or step in the crafting process might be second nature to someone who grew up around it.
description: When using a Crafting Skill to make objects from her native homeland or culture (like cuisine, medicine, weapons, art, clothing, etc.), this character considers her Skill rank to be 2 greater than its actual value.

name: Backup Plan
narative: Randomness and unpredictability are in every facet of life. Adjusting plans around known information and identifying points of uncertainty help things continue to go as smoothly as possible… but some people just wing it.
description: When taking the Wait Action, this character may name 2 events instead of 1. When either of the named events occurs, she may resolve Wait as normal.

name: Same Mistake Twice
narative: This character’s life hasn’t been forgiving of mistakes. She learns quickly in new situations, adjusting her process to avoid making disastrous errors… or at least make her slip-ups as minor as possible.
description: This character can only generate a maximum of 1 Margin of Failure for each Skill she uses during an Ongoing Challenge. If a failed Skill Challenge would generate additional Margins of Failure, they are ignored. Note that if the character uses two different Skills (like Barter and Bewitch), both can each generate 1 Margin of Failure during the Ongoing Challenge.

name: Teachings of Worlds Beyond
displayedReqs: Requirement: Have met with a Shinto priest, Oni hunter, or other organization (like the Red Library) with knowledge about how to best exploit these spirits and their weaknesses.
narative: The Shinto temples and shrines of Japan hold ancient secrets about the mysterious oni. Though established for the protection and reverence of natural spirits, the kami, the Shinto priesthood also serves as a barrier between the Beyond and other worlds. Their teachings are key to learning how to bind the oni and halt their rampages.

name: Calm Passage
displayedReqs: Requirement: Has reached -5 Wounds or lower
narative: Death is inevitable. This character has come to terms with that, and does not let the fatalities of others affect her. For some reason, Fate takes this into consideration. Constructs exploding, elemental beasts unraveling, and Undead leaking to pieces do not interrupt this character’s life.
description: This character is unaffected by all Demise Talents generated by allies and enemies. She must still resolve her own Demise Talents, if she has any.

name: Oath of Nonviolence
narative: This character has sworn she will bring no pain or suffering to another being. While the world makes it difficult to keep this vow, she finds it helps her connect with the aether. Her spells flow much easier, though this blessing becomes temporarily jarred when she causes injury.
description: At the start of this character’s turn, if she took no Attack actions and dealt no damage during her last turn, she may add +2 and any one suit to any Doctor or Magical Skill duels she takes on her current turn or gain **Defensive +1**. This bonus does not apply to any Magia or Immuto that have the potential to deal damage.

name: Don’t Look at Explosions
narative: Everyone knows… but so few actually do it.
description: Whenever this character would suffer damage from [b], she may discard any number of cards. For each card discarded this way, she may ignore 2 damage caused and any Conditions she would gain (like **Dazed** or **Poison**) from the [b].

name: Protect the Innocent
narative: Codes of honor often include assurances the strong will protect the weakest and most vulnerable of society, especially those who find themselves in the crossfire of conflict.
description:
Once per turn, this character may discard a card to gain the following Condition until the end of Dramatic Time:

**Protect the Innocent +1**: When an enemy within 10 yards resolves an attack action against an Innocent, she may reduce the value of this Condition by exactly 1. Before the enemy character resolves their action, this character may resolve a 1 AP action. If this is an attack, it must be resolved against the enemy character; it cannot declare Triggers. This Condition can have a maximum value of 3.

An Innocent is any character the Fated considers friendly, with a Wounds Aspect of 5 or less, who does not have any Ranged or Close Combat Skills with a value of 3+.
